channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Possible Illegal migrants living in that house, and landord hasn't registered house with the council, 29th October
item.description:
It is possible that some illegal migrants are living in this house. Moreover, the landord has not registered the house with the council. People throw bins at the front of the house in night when no one is around and walkaway. Around 20-23 people are living
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenworthy Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Telephone exchange door not locking, 29th October
item.description:
The metal doors on the telephone/internet exchange outside 2 Cricketfield Rd is unlocked and sits open all the time. I am concerned that it will be vandalised and/or connections damaged that will effect multiple properties on the Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricketfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 rubbish bin, 29th October
item.description:
Station Rise SE27 9BW outside number 12 (Xquisite restaurant) is a Lambeth black plastic combined litter / recycle litter bin which is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor re attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8A, Station Rise, Tulse Hill, London

item.title: Rubbish left outside and on top of bins, 29th October
item.description:
2 Cricketfield has multiple flats and there is constantly rubbish left on the pavement, next to the bins. It is getting worse and worse. Itâ€™s a health risk and trip hazard every day, I move the bins out of the way regularly.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricketfield Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pile of rubbish, 29th October

item.title: Mattress and rubbish has been dumped, 29th October
item.description:
Mattress and rubbish has been dumped on pavement outside 20 Waverley Crescent, Plumstead, London SE18. Eyesore and is partly blocking the pavement. Think it was put there late on 28/10/25 or early morning 29/10/25. I didn't see it being dumped.

item.title: Street light 8 not working, 29th October
item.description:

item.title: Sidcup Hill, 29th October
item.description:
Flags are being hanged up aling Sidcp Hill by two groups of men with with ladders. They were making racist remarks to me and my son while we were having an evening walk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foots Cray High Street, North Cray, London

item.title: Flag put up outside my property., 29th October
item.description:
Three men appeared outside my property putting up a flag on the lamp post outside my house. I went outside to ask them to please not put it up outside my property. The three men proceeded to mock me and my partner and then told us a story about a funeral taking place tomorrow and that they would be back to take down the flags. Clearly, I donâ€™t believe that and I am now left feeling unsafe and uncomfortable in my own house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
